item.title: Are Americans living in a police state?
item.description: ICE immunity, Greenland and imperialism, through readers’ eyes.

item.title: The Virginia GOP’s last-ditch effort to punish ‘dreamers’
item.description: Snatching in-state tuition rates from illegal immigrants is cruel.

item.title: Cartoon by Rob Rogers
item.description: Rob Rogers cartoon on Donald Trump, Jerome Powell and the Federal Reserve.

item.title: Plato falls victim to campus culture wars
item.description: Jettisoning the Greek philosopher hurts students who yearn to learn how to reason, argue and think.

item.title: Why Trump went to the Poconos
item.description: The GOP is in a bind: How can it activate the MAGA base without firing up anti-Trump voters, too?

item.title: I’ve waited for this electrifying moment in Iran for 10 years
item.description: A decade after I was freed from Evin prison, protests are rocking Iran — and planning is vital.

item.title: Trump wants a bigger military. There’s just one problem.
item.description: Meeting America’s defense needs is more important than reflexive GOP opposition to tax increases.

item.title: Trump is planning to rescue a crucial part of the American Dream
item.description: The president is moving to end Wall Street’s grip on housing prices.

item.title: Why fight Denmark? It’s practically MAGA-land!
item.description: Trump threatens Copenhagen over Greenland, but he’d like much else about the Danes.

item.title: I’m an astronaut. Here’s what the ISS emergency reveals.
item.description: Missions to Mars and the moon will require more advanced medical technology.

item.title: Don’t follow Trump’s example on aspirin
item.description: For many people, a daily aspirin may do more harm than good.

item.title: How the Iranian regime falls
item.description: Easing pressure on the regime at its point of maximum vulnerability would be a mistake.

item.title: ISS crisis
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on medical emergency at the International Space Station.

item.title: Grok’s ‘weapons of abuse’
item.description: Elon Musk hurts the AI industry by refusing to crack down on explicit images of women and girls.

item.title: Maryland needs a taxpayer revolt like California’s
item.description: Property taxes, New York rent, the national debt, Heather Heyer and Kent State, through readers’ eyes.

item.title: The biggest broken promise of Trump’s second term
item.description: Fed Chairman Jerome Powell is the Justice Department’s latest political target.

item.title: Trump cannot cap credit card interest rates
item.description: Thankfully, the president lacks the power to bar companies from charging more than 10 percent.

item.title: Why we stay in Minneapolis
item.description: Violence plagues Minneapolis. Comic artist K. Woodman-Maynard explores why she still loves living there.

item.title: What’s Trump’s endgame? I answered your questions.
item.description: David’s live chat with readers started at 12 p.m. ET on Monday. Read the transcript.

item.title: The man who voted for Washington and Lincoln
item.description: John Phillips of Sturbridge, Massachusetts, lived to be 104 and has a unique place in U.S. history.

item.title: The Supreme Court’s chance to stop punting on transgender status
item.description: Cases provide an opportunity to protect girls’ sports and put constitutional questions to rest.

item.title: Trump was an imperialist all along
item.description: The president is trapped in a Gilded Age bubble where tariffs and resource grabs are prized.

item.title: Trump’s surprising win for the climate
item.description: The plan to advance nuclear energy will help reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

item.title: Israel recognized this small enclave as a country. America should, too.
item.description: Somaliland has free elections, a flag, currency — but only Israel has recognized this reality.

item.title: An odd tolerance for murderous dictators
item.description: Trump’s Venezuela policy is debatable. Maduro’s evil isn’t.
